intro: Prestonia cearensis, commonly known as the Cearense prestonia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forested or disturbed habitats. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Prestonia cearensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
